This property verifies that when the push signal is asserted high, the wbuf_addr_r array element at the index specified by the previous value of wbuf_wp_r will be assigned the previous value of i_addr on the next clock cycle.

Specifically:
- The trigger condition occurs at every positive edge of the i_clk clock when push equals 1
- The expected behavior is that one clock cycle later, the wbuf_addr_r array element indexed by the previous value of wbuf_wp_r must equal the previous value of the i_addr signal
- The timing relationship requires that the assignment check happens exactly one clock cycle after the push assertion
- The $past function is used to reference values from the previous clock cycle for both wbuf_wp_r and i_addr
- There are no explicit reset or disable conditions specified in this property
